title: My tree
creator_contributor_role: Australia. Dept. of Education, Employment and Workplace Relations, partner
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Indigenous peoples - Social life and customs
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Children - Family relationships
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Family - Australia
abstract: A journey down a culturally complicated family tree.
description: Families are always moving forward and tend to rarely dwell on the past. However, its important for Kamsani Bin Salleh to find out about his family history, for a greater sense of who he is, if nothing else. As he trawls his family history, he discovers the vast array of cultures that have contributed to his existence.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2001913; One past eight futures : Foundation for Young Australians : Digital Storytelling project; Active; 2009
